Parameters:
inputStream - Stream to read
Returns:
SHA code
Throws:

isVirtualLink

public static boolean isVirtualLink(java.io.File file)
Indicates if a file is a virtual link.
A virtual link in Linux system is a way to have a reference to a file/directory as if it is in place, but the real file is other place. It is a way to share the same file by several directory

Parameters:
file - File to test
Returns:
true if it is a virtual link

Returns:

obtainExternalFile

public static java.io.File obtainExternalFile(java.lang.String path)
Obtain a file outside of the code.
If this class is in a jar called A.jar, and this jar is in /My/Path/A.jar then the file will be relative to /My/Path

Parameters:
path - Relative path
Returns:
The file

readStream

public static int readStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                             byte[] array)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Read stream and fill an array.
The write in array start at begin.
It stop to read stream if stream reach its end or the array is full.
Do same as readStream(inputStream, array, 0, array.length)

Parameters:
inputStream - Stream to read
array - Array to fill
Returns:
Number of bytes read (It can be less than array length if stream have not enough data to fill totaly the array)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On reading issue

readStream

public static int readStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                             byte[] array,
                             int offset)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Read stream and fill an array.
The write in array start at the offset specify.
It stop to read stream if stream reach its end or the array is full
Do same as readStream(inputStream, array, offset, array.length - offset)

Parameters:
inputStream - Stream to read
array - Array to fill
offset - To start writing
Returns:
Number of bytes read (It can be less than array length if stream have not enough data to fill totaly the array)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On reading issue

readStream

public static int readStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                             byte[] array,
                             int offset,
                             int length)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Read stream and fill an array.
The write in array start at the offset specify.
It stop to read stream if stream reach its end or the specify length is reach

Parameters:
inputStream - Stream to read
array - Array to fill
offset - To start writing
length - Number of bytes to read at maximum
Returns:
Number of bytes read (It can be less than specify length if stream have not enough data to respect the length)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - On reading issue
